description: Sigma(x) has no even solution n.
example: a(2) = 10 because there is no x < 10 whose sigma(x) = 10, an even number.
mathematica: a = {}; Do[ s = DivisorSigma[ 1, n ]; If[ EvenQ[ s ], a = Append[ a, s ] ], {n, 1, 400} ]; Complement[ Table[ 2n, {n, 1, 200} ], Union[ a ] ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 18 2001
